titleStmt.title: List of payments [later than Phamenoth 5, 155 AD]

msContents.summary: List of groups (pittakia) of lessees of state land who made their tax payments in kind; amounts of land, dates and payments of taxes in wheat are given; at the end of each group there is a summation of the total amounts of land held by the group

msItem.note: Written across the fibers; on the front P.Col. V 1 recto 4
There is a large number of vacant spaces left for entries that were never written
178 lines of writing in 10 cols. in a fast, small, and irregular hand; the document is incomplete
Each pittakion includes 3 to 8 landholders; the first man in each group is the leader (pittakiarches)
The members of a pittakion could associate with themselves one or two joint farmers in the lease
In the document several estates appear: usiac land is kept apart from other categories of land
Members of the pittakion held their land as subtenants of the pittakiarch, but paid their rent in kind to the state; pittakiarchs were responsible in case of default by individuals
The leases of land may not have been undertaken on an entirely voluntary basis
The document was frequently revised with transfers and additions of holdings
If taxes on land distant from Philadelphia were paid in distant granaries, a differential charge was imposed upon taxpayers

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from M. Nahman through H.I. Bell, in July 1923; no. 1,8-10-7 (Lot II) in Bell
